intro: Gouania acreana, commonly known as the Brazilian rock nettle, is a flowering plant belonging to the Malvaceae family. It is native to South America, particularly Brazil, and thrives in rocky and arid environments. The plant features erect stems covered in fine hairs and produces small, clustered flowers with five petals. Its leaves are ovate to lanceolate, often with serrated edges, and are usually hairy on both surfaces. Gouania acreana is known for its medicinal properties and has been used in traditional remedies for various ailments.
